Reviews.Title: “Do trust them . Nd food are bad”
Reviews.Author: mantoooos
Reviews.Content: The breakfast very poor . Nd the room service wen stole from our room one pack of cigaret Nd no one care from the management

Reviews.Title: “Group tour in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: I B
Reviews.Content: First of all let me say that I didn't choose the hotel. It was chosen from our travel agent on our group tour to Istanbul. Before getting to Turkey I sat down and read all the reviews that were written here. Judging from the reviews I would to have to deal with rude staff, things missing from my safe, no TV, no heat, no decent breakfast and so on. See I couldn't change the hotel, only my tour guide could, so I was prepared for the worst. First of all let me say that my stay at the Gran Star was overall a very pleasant and comfortable one. The room gave you a sense of warmth and coziness. The beds were very comfortable. The room and the bathroom were clean. We had a fridge, a lcd television with satellite receiver, hair dryer and a safe. The staff was very polite and willing to help. At least the people we interacted with. They didn't understand English well but if they didn't understand something they always tried to find someone who understood and did their best to help. After all in Istanbul English is not a common language. The staff's knowledge of English was on par with most of the shops or restaurants we went. Not much but not zero either. We used the safe and there never were any items or money missing from it. Even my personal items hold the same exact place where I left them on the table or chairs. About the TV, there is a tv set in the room which has only one Turkish channel but there is also a digital satellite receiver which is connected to the tv and has more than 200 free channels( English speaking channels like bbc and cnn included). Itâ€™s obvious that it isnâ€™t the hotels fault if someone uses only the TV and not the satellite receiver underneath it. The breakfast was nice and and with a fair number of choices. The food was fresh and very tasty. Of course there were a few quirks, but nothing serious. Would I stay there again? Of course I would.

Reviews.Title: “Ehab Alhamdi”
Reviews.Author: Ehab A
Reviews.Content: I left the hotel on 9 of December and it's a very beautiful hotel in a very nice Location. With my regards to all.

Reviews.Title: “Very horrible service! NOt recommended at all!”
Reviews.Author: Naji H
Reviews.Content: Receptionist are terrible, so rude, never care about their guests, u approach the reception counter, the never look at you, maybe 3 staff behind the counter just having a conversation, so you have to wIt for them until they finish, and when u ask about something, they are not helpful at all. I called from the room asking to book a tour in the boat, the staff answered in rude way that it is closed, so then I called the company tour by myself and find out that t is open! Again I called to come and fix my terrible Internet in the room, and the receptionist answer was: ' you come down and bring your laptop' ! what kind of service is this? Then I asked the receptionist please if anyone ask about me just say that I am not staying in this hotel, so what happened after is that someone came to ask about me at 3 am and they called my room to wake up me at this time even I didn't answer the phone! Another thing, I came to the reception to ask about the time that I should leave if my plane is at 8 pm! And the answer was u should pay full day, oh gosh! I wasn't talking about money, then the receptionist called a guy and the guy came as he is a big thing and said I am the captain of this hotel! I dnt care what ever u are, just give me a good service! The only thing acceptable in this hotel is the food and beverage staff, they are so nice and helpful, and they even ask if my stay is good in this hotel! Which was unfortunately NOT and I will never recommend this place to anyone! I had 4 terrible nights in this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service, except from the bar tender. Rooms cleanliness disgusting. No one speaks English”
Reviews.Author: Toffys82
Reviews.Content: Spent a weekend in the hotel with my girlfriend. First impression was ok, and the location is great, a 1 min walk from the bustling taksim street. The room was quite, and seemed to be clean until we looked what was under the bed! It seemed for past month they have sweeping all the dirt rite under the bed. I saw dirty Kleenex rolled up, a layer of dust and what seemed to be empty nut cases. Tv channels extremely confusing and breakfast was just horrid, we had to leave the hotel to have decent BF. When calling reception, no one spoke English, they kept referring us to some else until they found someone in the hotel who spoke the very basic of English. The only person that was welcoming and who actualy very nice with us and who spoke the best English was the bartender. If anything, he was the only person that was doing something right. When checking out, we had to call our driver to pick us from hotel, asked the reception to make a 30 second call, she seemed very angy and charged us for the call. I got on the taxi and told myself what a lovely and exciting city and will def be visiting, but DEFENETLY not in that hotel, unless they make the bartender the manager!!

Reviews.Title: “It 's good but not like before”
Reviews.Author: nadine25112011
Reviews.Content: I had spent two times in grand star before this time really this time wasnot so good as before but it was okey first of all they asked for 100dollars before check in while we payed fully payment but we checked in in mintues actually it did not take time , the room was clean and very new but was small, the breakfast was n't so good you can imagine that i spent 10 days and the breakfast was the same every day and the hot plates werar little. The hotel is very ohnest and safe and the room service was polite, also we made check out in 5mintues the reception men were decent especially ender was very helpful .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Ykilical
Reviews.Content: Great location with easy access, and a beautifully decorated room with an amazing view of the Bosphorus! The staff was very hospitable and catered to all of our needs. I definitely would recommend this hotel to friends and family!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: abdul k
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for three nights and we were really impressed.The rooms are clean and comfortable, we experienced real hospitality during our stay. Thank you Again.

Reviews.Title: “VERY GOOD HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: MARIA C
Reviews.Content: Located on a very central area. The staff is very friendly and helpful.The rooms are clean and comfortable. Overall a good value of money

Reviews.Title: “THIEVES AND CROOKS ... DO NOT STAY HERE...”
Reviews.Author: Oalimou
Reviews.Content: I have just returned home from supposedly a lovely short business trip to a nightmare in Istanbul. When i arrived at the hotel we were greeted by the guys at the reception who barely spoke English and would totally ignore you whilst you talk to them. Anyways we were given our two rooms and after getting some rest we decided to go for a stroll, came home and went to sleep. The second day however i got up early and went to a business meeting just outside of Istanbul then went had lunch and a some sight seeing. I got home around 1 AM, the following day i got up around 11 AM got ready and tried to open the safety box that was in my room. I put my code in and i got an error did it a couple more times and got the same error message. I decided to call reception who sent someone to the room to open the box. Minutes later a man came and opened the box by putting the master code. After he left i decided to check my things credit cards, money and passport. I was suspicious because normally i wouldn't get that error message unless somebody opened the box therefore my numbers didn't work. When i counted my money $2000 were missing, they left me barely enough money to get home. I was shocked and in disbelief. I ran to reception and asked to speak to the owner or manager or who ever is in charge. They called the manager and owner who did not at all seemed concerned nor interested in what i had to say. And instead of him being reassuring he was asking me questions like " Are you sure you actually have this kind of money" and " Do you have any proof that you brought this money with you to Turkey" and here i am trying to get this guy to believe me. He was coming up with all kinds of scenarios about me perhaps forgetting to lock the box before i left or maybe my colleague somehow being the culprit. There and then i knew that they were all in it together and it was all a setup because of their negative reaction, their lack of concern and the way i was treated. I then threatened to call the police if they didn't show me more respect and attention. The manager then waved a paper in my face that i had signed when i checked in, i did not even read it simply because i was checking into a supposedly a 4 star hotel i mean what could be on it so i simply signed it and never looked back. Well it turns out that this paper says that the hotel is not responsible for anything that goes missing in the rooms, and that the hotel has the right to sue me if any complaints are made. I asked the reception to call the police and they refused telling me " if you want the police go to them yourself, we will not call them for you". I went to the police and told them what had happened, they sent two guys with me to the hotel they started an investigation. After hours and hours of questioning one of police guys told me that there was noway i could get my money back, simply because i can not prove anything and that there is no chance that the hotel could be held accountable. Not only that but i run the risk of them pressing charges on me. So it would be a good idea to let it go and bite the bullet. I do not recommend this hotel to my worst enemy.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, horrible and horrible”
Reviews.Author: audis
Reviews.Content: Whatever the management responds to my feedback: This hotel can only leave me with 3 words: Horrible, horrible and horrible. A dirty room in the basement is far from the photos the "4" star hotel presents itself on different hotel pages. So my advice is to everybody spending a holiday in Istanbul: Dont stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Bussiness travel to Istambul”
Reviews.Author: totito
Reviews.Content: Hotel well located, old, rooms newly renovated, small, clean. When booking, ask for a view of the Bosphorus. Reasonable breakfast. Common areas very old, should be reformed as the rooms. Hotel only sleeping

Reviews.Title: “great city great hotel”
Reviews.Author: muharrem m
Reviews.Content: o my god such a big city istanbul.crazy square taksim and this hotel is hard of the taksim. room are realy ok and big for the city hotel.you can arrive verys easy to all historic areas .arround hotel you have so many facility bar,restourant,shoping. hotel staff was so kind

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay In This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dan666_26
Reviews.Content: Simply terrible. Some people at the reception are so rude and barely understand English. We asked for swimming pool or at least Jacuzzi as written available in the hotel and the only answer from the staff was "doesn't work" "doesn't work" with a very rude face. We were so angry because before booking we insisted on choosing a hotel with a swimming pool and Jacuzzi. We booked two rooms (we were 4), in one room the TV worked for only 1 night and the other 2 nights it wouldnâ€™t turn on, and in the second room there was only 1 channel and it is for kids. Our air condition was so noisy as if there were a storm in the room and its remote control doesn't work so we had to borrow the remote of the other room. Our rooms had terrible views while it was stated that all hotel rooms have bosphorous views, also our rooms were 3 floors under the reception in the old part of the hotel as if we were hiding from war or something! We were also accused of using the mini bar while we didn't touch anything and they had my mum sign that we didn't eat anything from the mini bar. They accused us for drinking a can of coke which was already hidden by someone else in the room, and by opening a can of peanuts also already open by someone before us. It was simply a terrible experience and we own a travel agent so we will make sure that we never book rooms for anyone in this hotel. The only thing great about it was its location. The breakfast was fine but there should be more types of corn flakes with better tastes.

Reviews.Title: “worst honeymoon ever:(”
Reviews.Author: bob22_11
Reviews.Content: I really feel bad every time I remember that experience with that really bad hotel, we had a reservation of a room with one queen bed and when we arrived after a long trip of about 12 hours and finally get to the hotel, we were shocked when we checked in because they told us there is only one room available which is of twin bed and no one of queen bed. we tried to discuss with the manager and even we showed him the reservation for queen bed and we were trying to explain to him that this is our honeymoon BUT he WAS NOT helpful but rude telling us if u don't want this room u can just leave and find yourself another hotel," can u imagine after 12 hours trip being tired taking to the manager and that was the answer". beside that the hotel wasn't that clean or even neat, housekeeping was awful just like the reception staff. their food is not good at all and their menu is sooo limited. shortly i don't recommend this hotel for any one. just do not go there. just remembering this hotel makes me hate Istanbul despite it is a very beautiful city indeed

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: max a
Reviews.Content: The worst hotel I have ever stayed in my life. When I arrived they gave me room which"s window was looking directly to reception. Reseption guys chatted till morning then 7 in the morning shift changed. They were joking, laughing and I couldnt sleep all night. In the morning I asked the manager to change my room. He said just pack your staff and we will change your room. In the evening when I came back I found out that they didnt change my room. I talked to manager he said that you have to pay additional 60$ for every night to change your room, which I booked for 100$. I refused to pay that money and said that I will never come back and manager replies to me was "Ok, dont come back". Reception staff is really rude, unhelpful & not interested at all for anything but finishing their shift. I asked the guy to call a taxi to airport he said that he will charge me 70TL which is real cost is 40TL. He got 30 TL from taxi driver and put his pocket, can you imagine?Otherwise hotel is little bit confusing - lots of corridors, stairs, very small lifts. Breakfast menu very poor.

Reviews.Title: “Grand or Economic Star Hotel?? Sketchy”
Reviews.Author: foodtourist13
Reviews.Content: I booked a room online at the Economic Star Hotel, and then found to my surprise and worry that the Economic Star Hotel didn't seem to exist! All I found out ahead of time was that the entrance was (suspiciously) the same as the Grand Star Hotel, but I felt at least relieved that I would have someone to talk directly to, in case things turned bad. I also sent them an email ahead of time and received a response (though not a very polite one). We arrived at the Grand Star Hotel and showed them our reservation number, and we were told that we had been "upgraded" to a room at the Grand Star Hotel. I asked about the Economic Star Hotel and was told that it was "attached" to the Grand Star, just behind it, and that the rooms were their more economic or standard rooms and that the Grand Star were the deluxe rooms, or something to that extent. So I believe that the Economic Star Hotel doesn't really exist, but is a way for the Grand Star Hotel to advertise rooms on online booking sites, perhaps at a cheaper price (we paid 80â‚¬ a night), but also under a different name to attract customers, since the Grand Star has some pretty bad reviews out there. The location, as noted, was the best thing about the hotel - a five minute walk, not even, from Taksim Square. The Grand Star Hotel room was nice - could've used vacuuming, but otherwise fairly luxurious (nice bedspreads and decoration, nice bathroom with an interesting shower with a shade that could be opened so the person in the shower can see into the room, and vice versa.. !!), though the shower door didn't shut completely and water got on the floor). The AC smelled bad, but we got used to it. Breakfast was good, with a variety of Western buffet items as well as some Turkish. Strangely, the fresh squeezed orange juice was an extra that was very overpriced, the equivalent of something like 3â‚¬ a glass. The staff, as has been noted, were not friendly in the least. The initial email I sent was responded to with a curt line, and they never greeted us when we came in or out of the hotel. But the worst is the way guests are treated on this website - being accused of breaking things, and having "hysterical" children? How incredibly unprofessional, unwarranted, and downright impolite! On that note, we signed an agreement at the beginning of the stay that we would have to pay for anything we broke in the room, which I've *never* seen at a hotel before. Considering that a recent reviewer says that they had to pay $150 for a broken glass (and, the hotel claims, a broken mini-bar door - but even so, a huge amount of money!), I was worried that I would be wrongly charged for the already broken shower door, or anything else, though fortunately I was not. Maybe they're trying to improve their reviews. In all, our stay was fine, but I was so worried about something going wrong that I don't think I'd go back there - I just don't trust them and I think they treat guests very unprofessionally.

Reviews.Title: “if i will come back i will stay here”
Reviews.Author: nadine25112011
Reviews.Content: i went at last winter to istanbul and i stayed at grand star. actually i liked my stay first of all the location was perfect it is located at taksim square and the hotel is so clean and organized and the room was clean ,modern with lcd tv and the view was perfect but if you choose the square view other wise not good view. the breakfast was sooooooooo nice as i went to alot of hotels 4 stars at istanbul and this was the perfect, the food was tasty and plenty of food . the last point that reception men were so helpful and honest and the value of money is so suitable to the service you will get i wish really to come back

Reviews.Title: “Will never come back to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: middx_11
Reviews.Content: The worst hotel I have ever stayed in, the reception staff and managers not friendly and unhelpful, Not a child friendly hotel, The only thing they were after was our money and came up with their own rules what suited them , My daughter broke a glass cabinet in the room we informed the reception staff made us pay $ 150 dollors, made a disater booking with the airport transfer we paid them in advance 80 TL and at the time of the transfer asked for another 40 TL totalling to 120 TL, accused us of damaging the room furniture and over charged us for the things we didn't even consume from the room fridge also told if we take our breakfast to the room from the buffet than we have to pay extra...

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yoga777
Reviews.Content: Best location and may be you must go to itiklal street near hotel it's a nice area contains restaurants and nice shop and there is also taksim squair near hotel you will find metro station and tour by bus over the city. Yassir

Reviews.Title: “very pedestrian hotel”
Reviews.Author: devanand0000000000
Reviews.Content: To begin with the staff is rude and unfriendly. People hardly understand English and are un-cooperative. When going for breakfast, someone came in and stole money from our bag. The reception counter told us that it is our fault that we did not keep money in the safe- for which they charge a deposit. Whoever would think that someone would sneak in - the cleaning staff only visited the room as per the cameras when we went for breakfast to inspect the room. when it was obvious as to who could have taken the money, the staff curtly told us that we had signed saying that the hotel is not responsible for any theft. Breakfast was ordinary, with coffee and tea being extremly bitter. Rooms are gaudy and the rooms are in a basement where you can ehar the TV from other rooms. Only good thing about the hotel is the location. But surely one can find other hotels at lower cost in Taksim area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location - Bad staff”
Reviews.Author: dsader
Reviews.Content: I would describe my stay at the Grand Star Hotel Istanbul in May 2011 as a non comfortable stay. I was on vacation in Istanbul where I stayed in Sultanahmet and wanted to stay couple of days near Taksim square\Istiklal avenue. I will start with the positives, the hotel is in an excellent location near Taksim and Istiklal avenue. The Hotel facility is good and the rooms are pretty well acceptable. However my problem was with the Hotel staff, they are very unprofessional and lack customer service skills. They are rude and not responsive especially the nightly shift reception personnel. They make you feel uncomfortable and treat you as if you are being served for free. The room housekeeping was not good enough, they barely rearranged our Bed without cleaning anything else. The breakfast was very poor with little choices of food. The beverages are awful we couldn't drink them. I watched everyone around and found out that nobody was able to drink their juice since they lack flavor. In short, I don't recommend anybody to stay at this hotel. And I advice the management of this hotel to rethink staff training especially in the area of customer service.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Vila Real de Santo Antonio, Portugal
Reviews.Title: “you 'feel' Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: MartaFerrer
Reviews.Content: This hotel turned out to be a pleasent surprise in our visit to Istanbul: its location is great, close to Taksim Square and to Istiklal Avenue, where you can feel the pulse and the life of this amazing city, full of stores, restaurants and bars; although surrounded by all this buzz, you can get a good night of sleep thanks to the insonorization. The breakfast offers a nice selection of food, where you can choose intercontinental breakfast or a selection of local tastes. The only 'but' that we have to the hotel is the slow process on check-in... but not negative at all... Definitly a place to stay over and over again!

Reviews.Title: “the city's heartbeats”
Reviews.Author: perhane
Reviews.Content: i stayed there a couple of times recent years in a bosphorus viewing room (from some distance but enough to feel it in the morning). early morning seagulls in and around the balcony were a nice surprise. rooms and beds were good. once the front office was rude to me about a thing but the chef somewhat made it up serving me a late breakfast plate the day after. if you like to hear istanbul's heartbeats, grand star is a reasonable pick. it is also within walking distance to intercity bus offices and airport shuttles.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money spent and very rude manager”
Reviews.Author: karan1
Reviews.Content: Location is very good just next to Taksim square with lot of eating joints and hustle and bustle.Actually it is an average 3 star and not even near a four star as they claim.The same buffet breakfast is served everyday with very limited choice.have to pay for Fresh juice in morning breakfast. I had to wait for two hours to check in even though i had booked well in advance.I arrived at 12 afternoon and that rude manager who is busy playing on his computer dosent even bother to see who is standing in front of him at the reception.I told him that check in on website says 11.30 but he was least bothered. Even at 2 pm I had to go to him and remind him of my booking- worst manager i have seen till yet.His name is Okan Agaoglu.Rest of the staff were decent. The standard rooms are in fact in the basement and have no view even if they have a balcony.There is no lift for these rooms. At night the corridor is dark as the lighting was defective.The bathroom is ok.

Reviews.Title: “don't even think about”
Reviews.Author: shaher98
Reviews.Content: The only positive thing is the location ,, but the breakfast varaity and quality was very poor, the stuff dealing with problems was very bad i think they no nothing about tourist concept and the most tricky point isthat the rooms not like the pictures in their websit .

Reviews.Title: “Terrible stay RUINING my whole vacation,RUDE personnel,lousy wall view,breakfast with no bread”
Reviews.Author: Franjie
Reviews.Content: Terrible stay !!!! RUDE staff from receprionist (with no tag names) up to their conductor= general manager Mr. Mustafa !!! The worst stay I've ever experienced in my 50 yrs. life. No bread at breakfast by 9:30 a.m. & you have to lump their deficiencies with their lousey service, rude reaction by personnel . Their receptionist doesn't only bullies the guest by his rudness, aided by lack of name tag 4 identification, but also with his colleagues orchestrating sarcastically unhelpful 2 tease. What worst can one encounter,ugly view, rude untagged personnel, basic deficiencies to bare necessities like B R E A D. T E R R I B L E standard of staff & service. N E V E RRRRRR !

Reviews.Title: “This is one sleezy Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: montessorimama
Reviews.Content: I used this hotel which we prepaid from the States to house myself and a group of 28 people for an overnight stay before an early morning departure for the US. It was supposed to be a 4 star hotel, and it didn't even have Air Conditioning that worked. The night we stayed it was hot and muggy. Of the ten rooms that we occupied, 7 had A/C that didn't work, and one room had a large wooden panel removed from the wall, laid on one of the beds and the wet carpet was rolled back with mold below! We asked the disrespectful and downright nasty management to change to another room and were told they had no other rooms and we would just have to make do. When we went to depart for the airport, the management presented us with an excessive bill for use of the "minibars" in the room. On consulting with all of the group participants, noone had even consumed anything from the minibars. The management threatened to call the police and would not give us our luggage if we didn't pay the shakedown! Our transport bus was waiting and we had to pay their fraudulent bill so we could get to the airport on time. This hotel should be avoided by travelers from the US, and actually by anyone who does not want their wonderful Turkey vacation ruined by a hotel with a website that misrepresents the quality of the facilities and has rude and unscrupulous employees.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: aksel1
Reviews.Content: Booked hotel with TurkeyTPS. TurkeyTPS were great and the hotel was great. We stayed in a double room , the size of the room was large. The hotel was very good and clean and the location was fantastic. The streets around this hotel are very busy, but this is Taksim and the main street to visit is Istiklal Cad which is 1 minute away, Only a couple of small problems. We arrived and our room was not ready with a double bed so we had to wait about 45mins but was sorted and finally i ordered from reception a car to take five of us to the airport and paid a high amount for this, and when it arived it was a standard size car ,so 5 of us had to squeeze into it. Otherwise very good.

Reviews.Title: “very clean rooms & cooperate manager”
Reviews.Author: khaled_b41
Reviews.Content: I was surprised when I read the last comment about the hotel. Actually the furniture was very clean as if the room was already furnished. The manager of the hotel (Mustafa Kucukcakan) is seen frequently in the restaurant at breakfast time asking the residents about their opinion about the services and how it could be improved. Location is very near to metro station, so you can easily moving.

Reviews.Title: “Never ever go here! Terrible, Shocking, Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: KevwanLondon
Reviews.Content: I never write hotel reviews and always rely on others. This hotel was so bad, that I feel the need to share my shocking experience. Now I could write a very long story about the poor service at this hotel, but please allow me to bullet point: Bad Service Agressive Manager Unhelpful Staff Inconsider approach - We got back to find our room had turned into a building site (photos uploaded)!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Please do check out the photos. We had gone out on Business and left are stuff around the room (not packed, and this is what we came back too with no notice. The staff had clearly rooted through our belongings Facilities are not included, you pay extra Charged extra for whatever form of payment you choose to use Dirty Terrible food. Drilling at early hours and late at night On the plus side; its in a decent location.

Reviews.Title: “very bad hotel, the worst of all, very bad image for Turkey, stealing is the best they can do”
Reviews.Author: Pikoegypt
Reviews.Content: I travelled with some friends and relatives last winter but we had the worst vacation, at our second day in the hotel we got stolen by the hotel staff, we were having breakfast leaving '' Don't Disturb Sign" but one of the hotel staff entered our room and took from our bags 300USD and from our friends'room 200USD. The hotel general manager showed a very unhelpful, careless and rude attitude, he said that there is no proof that the doer is one of his staff, although it was shown in the hotel's camera that on of the cleaning staff entered and stayed for about 13 min in the room cleaning nothing but stealing. Very bad hotel, the worst can any one stay at. I don't recommend it at all.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Clean Hotel with helpful Staffs.”
Reviews.Author: Azzam10
Reviews.Content: Very nice Hotel with perfect location. Rooms are quiet reasonable and very clean. Bathroom is very nice and clean. Breakfast is Superb. Staffs of restaurant are very good. The best of the Hotel is Okan the Front Office Manager who is the most helpful and polite person. He made our stay very comfortable and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “if one day i ll back to Istanbul - i ll choose this hotel :)”
Reviews.Author: Princese
Reviews.Content: Very good location - near cafes bars restaurants clubs shops (3-5 minut walks) and buss, dolmus, metro and taxi station.Everything what u want - u can find nearly :) Ð¡lean and comfortable otel, varied and delicious food for breakfast (hot and cold snacks, sweets, cereals, fruit, drinks in large assrtimente). Good servise - when I asked to change my room (with one big bed)- done without problems, and! -given a room with stunning views of the Bosphorus!!!! The hotel has a hammam, sain, jacuzzi and swimming pool! I had a really good holiday staying at this hotel! highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Hmm... maybe 3 star hotel but excelent location”
Reviews.Author: baniix
Reviews.Content: Altrough my visit was some 2 years ago I'll write my review of this hotel since I recently joined Trip advisor. I came as a part of a group with my girlfriend and did not expect a lot of hotel, since my target was to explore Istanbul. The group stayed for 3 days and we extended our stay for additional 3. Room was very poor with no view, but it was clean (housekeeping +) which was enough to satisfy our needs becouse we were out most of the day. We never saw smile on receptionists faces and that was frustrating becouse if you asked them something it was like you were disturbing them which is unacceptable becouse you're paying the rate, but smile should come for free or otherwise you don't have to work in a hotel. In fact they were curteus only when I ordered a transfer to the airport, guy insisted on paying directly to him and smiled only then. Of course some private dirty car picked us up, it could at least be clean for the price we payed! Maybe I'm not objective becouse now I'm working at Le Meridien, but reception really needs a change! Breakfast was very good and + for the personel working there. Anyway the hotel was hmm, 2-3stars, but I would not return there! I'll add some photos later on...

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay. Excellent location. Nice view to Bosphore”
Reviews.Author: blue1000
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an excellent location. It is clean and decent. The staff are neither helpful nor rude. Fresh orange juice is for extra but they do offer machine orange juice for free like other hotels. Overall, good impression.

Reviews.Title: “Bad hotel with worse staff”
Reviews.Author: Veleno75
Reviews.Content: The list of the bad things found in this hotel is so long I don't know where to start. - I arrived at 9am and checked in. My room was not ready (perfectly acceptable, I didn't even want it so early) so I left my trolley and told that I wanted a Smoking room with King bed. No reply arrived. - I came back at the hotel from the office at 9pm: I got my room key, and asked "My luggage is already in the room, isn't it?". The amazing answer was "No, I think it's that." and the receptionist pointed to my trolley, that has been left in the middle of the hall all day long. Just where everyone could have picked it on. - I got in the room, and -obviously- it was a Twin bed - NO smoking. - I went back to the reception, and there I was answered -rather arrogantly- "could you please show me on your reservation where this was said?". I answer I told it to the morning receptionist, and they replied me "They didn't tell us". As this could be MY problem... - Went back in the room, tried to work: on three plugs, only one was working. And I had to recharge both mobile and laptop... I couldn't. - I was thirsty: no complimentary water. - The WORST THING: THERE ARE NO CURTAINS! Just two micro-curtains on a 3m window! So, since my room was on the terrace, everyone could see inside it... and THE SUN WOKE ME UP AT 7 AM!! - I wanted to have breakfast: I went to the restaurant room, at 10.15 (because in every other hotel I've been breakfast ends at 10.30) and... it was over at 10. And NOBODY told me! Luckily, the morning after I checked out and went back to my usual hotel in Istanbul...

Reviews.Title: “Pity ....for the Bosporus view room in this hotel....”
Reviews.Author: AthensMak
Reviews.Content: such a hostile+unpolite reception personnel i ever met...,aged hotel,poor breakfast -u have to pay extra for a real juice-otherwise u drink the most chemic + sugar shock one...-or an omelet .At the opposite side ,because of the good location,the Bosporus view rooms at the higher floors with the tiny balcony were excellent....

Reviews.Title: “Three star at best. â‚¬20 for the pool? Forget it.”
Reviews.Author: clownshoes
Reviews.Content: This place is very well located, with nothing much else to recommend it. The twin room (at back, with a view of some other windows) was small, clean, with gold and red carpet and bedspreads, a pink marble bathroom, blackout curtains and quite good air-con. The decor was not in very good taste. The beds were firm, and the shower had good water pressure. The location is very central, walking distance to many dining/shopping/recreational destinations. The fact that the breakfast was so dull is no problem with so many affordable restaurants within spitting distance. When I arrived, an overeager porter insisted on taking my one suitcase (which I am more than capable of carrying) up the tiny elevator with me, then proceeded to fuss about with my air-con, making a song and dance over turning on my lights and opening the curtains then hung about waiting for me to tip. I let the embarrassing silence fill the room for a minute or two before he gave up and disappeared, empty-handed. The biggest rip-off was the gym. A tiny pool (two strokes and you would have completed a lap), two gym machines and a sauna, and the bloke on the desk down there told me it was twenty euro to enter the place! â‚¬20, for a gym, in a hotel!?!? I protested, and he spun me a story about how it's â‚¬40 for non-guests! Either a) this is a horrible rip-off or b) it's actually free and the guy was trying to get â‚¬20 out of me. Either way I declined. I didn't see any parking (not that I was looking) and the drop-off, on a narrow, busy street, would not be to everyone's taste. Didn't bother me. All in all, a hotel I will rapidly forget. neither thrilling or appalling. Just another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “realy good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Uykucu
Reviews.Content: realy good hotel with 4 star. i stayed with my friends and enjoyed with indoor swimmingpool. breakfast was relly good and staf was quite polite

Reviews.Title: “If the price is right, enjoyable home and excellent operating base”
Reviews.Author: dutchwanderer
Reviews.Content: Especially in big cities like Istanbul, oneâ€™s opinion about accommodation will be influenced by the price paid. My wife and I stayed here for a week at an o.k. rate and we thought it was great. The location is superb, almost right around the corner from Taxim and the Istiklal Caddesi. Metro, tram and busses all within a few hundred meters, the Istanbul public transport system belongs to the best in Europe. At the hotel, courteous staff. One young man, being a supporter of the Fenerbahce football club, was over the moon about the slamming of another Istanbul side in the same European competition. Whether or not one would call this patriotic, it tells about â€˜engagementâ€™ (Fr), a welcome characteristic in the service industry. We noticed such attitude with a good many employees at the hotel. (In fairness, a trait common to many Turkish people.) At Taxim is the 5 star hotel you may be looking for. With a majestic view from the top floor. But without that shop straight across the road, open until the early hours. A Hotel Grand Star facility you will feel free to use. It also allows you to enjoy the drink with the great view even more.

Reviews.Title: “A room with view: Bosphorus”
Reviews.Author: Vyvyverney
Reviews.Content: In general, it is a rather good hotel, clean, safe, well located near the Taksim square and in a walking distance from the Center of Conventions. People who are working at the reception are very kind but there are few among them talking English with fluency. The breakfast does need to be improved, many tasteless things are showed and I believe this compromises the overall hotel quality. We paid for having a room with nice view (6th floor) and we got it. To note that the bathroom is a small one. The sauna and swimming pool work well.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Grand Star
HotelInfo.Address: Siraselviler Caddesi No:45/1 | Taksim, Istanbul 34437, Turkey
